result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel P. Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Remove Anti-Theft Device (>$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(f).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
06/24/2016:  Sentence credit in the event of revocation is 66 days.
Cases 15CF1307, 16CF90, 15CM1536, 15CM1537 and 16CM1609 dismissed/read-in.  Jail credit if revoked to be determined.

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 15CF1247, 15CF1305 and 16CF121

miscConds.notes: plus 10% restitution surcharge.  Amount to be determined.  Joint/several with co-defendant, EMV.

No contact with directly or indirectly co-defendant, EMV.  No contact with Kohl's, JCPenney's, Kwik Trip, Plato's Closet, Mega Holiday, JF or JS.  Not to consume, use or possess any illegal drugs, alcohol or drug paraphernalia.  No entry into bars, taverns, liquor stores or places that primarily sell alcohol.
Any conditions, counseling or programming per agent.  Participate and complete treatment court.  Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision.  Follow rules of probation.

Administrative Transfer to Treatment Court
IT IS ORDERED: This case is transferred to Eau Claire County Circuit Court Branch 2 while defendant is a participant in the Treatment Court Program. The case will be administratively reassigned back to the initial court upon defendant's successful completion of the Eau Claire County Treatment Court Program, or upon defendant's termination from that program.
/s/ 4-5-2016
